title: `account_info.read` scope OAuth app access token can change token owner's account name.

summaries.content:
Previously, Dropbox API was split between App Folder and Full Dropbox apps. After the recent introduction of Scoped Access apps, which use OAuth scopes, a number of routes meant specifically for internal use were neither restricted to internal apps nor were they annotated with required scopes.

A new or migrated Scoped Access app with low-privileged scopes was able to make calls to these undocumented routes. This did not affect existing App Folder apps.

By using the endpoint `/2/account/change_name` to change the user's full name, I found out that it accepts OAuth requests but does not validate scope limitation. By using an access token with a read-only scope, I have successfully changed the token owner's full name. This allows any application owner to change every app users' dropbox name despite the the fact that the granted scope is insufficient. The Dropbox team rapidly mitigated this issue and restricted the usage of the endpoint from Scoped Access Apps.
